`BUILDING_DLL` used to be defined in place of the more classical  `<lib_name>_EXPORTS` to correctly export visibility macros in Windows, but 
the use of macro shared across different libraries created problems (see https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2262/symbol-visibility-issues-in-windows).
Now that the `GenerateExportHeader` CMake module is used, the [`DEFINE_SYMBOL`](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.5/prop_tgt/DEFINE_SYMBOL.html) should be already correctly defined to  `<lib_name>_EXPORTS` , 
and it should be possible to remove this definition, if I am not wrong.
